data.title: THE HISTORY OF THE CIA: Operation Sunrise and the Plan for a New Europe [pt. 2]
data.meta_description: The video delves into Operation Sunrise and the intricate web of alliances between the OSS and former Nazi officials like General Reinhard Gehlen
data.text:
Introduction to Part 2 of the series covering Operation Sunrise and a recap of the previous episode discussing the origins of the Office of Strategic Services (OSS) and Allen Dulles's role. Mention of IG Farben's involvement in Nazi activities.

Closing remarks on the episode and a preview of the next part focusing on OSS activities in Asia, specifically in China and Southeast Asia. Mention of future connections to the French Connection and Gladio operations.

Q: What was the Gehlen Organization?

A: The Gehlen Organization was a group established by Nazi General Reinhard Gehlen with plans to ensure the survival of Nazi Germany through a separate peace.

Q: Who were some of the Nazi war criminals saved through Operation Sunrise?

A: Hjalmar Schacht and SS General Karl Wolff were among the Nazi war criminals saved through Operation Sunrise.
